page.title: 06Ballikinrain School:Fintry
page.content:
The school is in the south west of this square and is actually within the parish of Killearn.
Ballikinrain - a mansion house built in 1868 and designed by David Bruce, was{bought by}the{Church of Scotland in 1969 and{opened in the same year}as a{state-sponsored Approved School.
In 104 acres, it provides care and fulltime education for 50 residential pupils and 5 day pupils. Primary and Secondary curricula are given to boys up to 16 years. External activities include cycling, fishing, football, horse riding, tennis, lapidary work, cricket and creative crafts.
The staff comprises 11 academic, 12 social, a domestic superintendent and 19 ancillary staff.
